Volume: 0cm³

Experiment Procedure

1.

Pour copper (II) chloride solution into the beaker to 50cm³.

2.

Insert the carbon rods, which must not touch each other.

3.

Attach the crocodile leads to the end of the rods.

4.

Select 4V on the power supply, and then switch it on.

5.

Use tweezers to hold a piece of blue litmus paper in the solution next to the positive electrode. What is this element? Write it into the table.

6.

Once 5 minutes have passed, switch off the power supply. Is there evidence of a metal coating on the negative electrode? What is it? Record this result into the table.
